manipulate_image module¶

manipulate_image.check_UUID_input(UUID)¶

Function checks to make sure UUID is a string

Parameters:UUID – user inputted unique identifier of the picture
Raises:ValueError – if UUID is not a string
Returns True:if pass test
manipulate_image.check_b64(b64)¶

Function checks if string is base64 and not empty

Parameters:

b64 – base64 string
Raises:
  • TypeError – if input is not base64
  • ValueError – if input is empty
manipulate_image.check_image_input(export_type)¶

Function checks if file type is .jpg, .png or .tiff

Parameters:export_type – user identified file type for image to be saved as
Raises:ValueError – if file extension is not .jpg, .png or .tiff
Returns True:if pass test
manipulate_image.check_proc_type(image_proc_type)¶

check_proc_type function checks to make sure image_proc_type is a string :param image_proc_type: user selected processing technique :raises ValueError: if image_proc_type is not a string :returns True: if pass test

manipulate_image.image_to_b64(filename)¶

Function transforms image to b64

Parameters:filename – image to be transformed to b64
Returns image_string:
 string of b64 code
manipulate_image.numpy_to_pic(np_array, filename)¶

Function transforms numpy array to image

Parameters:
  • np_array – numpy array to be turned into image
  • filename – file name image will be saved as
Returns image:

named filename
manipulate_image.pic_to_numpy(temp_file)¶

Function transforms image to numpy array

Parameters:temp_file – image to be numpified
Returns np_array:
 numpy array of image
manipulate_image.string_to_image(base64string, new_file_name)¶

Function transforms b64string to b64 to new file

Parameters:
  • base64string – b64 string of the image
  • new_file_name – name of image that b64 string will become
Returns image:

saved as new_file_name
